segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
12. The Ceremony of Descent
119. The Ceremony of Descent (1st)

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhāto navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya bhagavato avidūre ekamantaṃ ṭhito hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jāṇussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.

segments.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā jāṇussoṇiṃ brāhmaṇaṃ tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhātaṃ navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivatthaṃ allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ.
segments.en: The Buddha saw him,
and said,

segments.pli: “kiṃ nu tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhāto navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya ekamantaṃ ṭhito?
segments.en: “Brahmin, why have you bathed your head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes? Why are you standing to one side holding a handful of fresh grass?
What’s going on today with the brahmin clan?”
“Master Gotama, today is the ceremony of descent for the brahmin clan.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti?
segments.en: “But how do the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhātā navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivatthā allena gomayena pathaviṃ opuñjitvā haritehi kusehi pattharitvā antarā ca velaṃ antarā ca agyāgāraṃ seyyaṃ kappenti.
segments.en: “Well, Master Gotama, on the sabbath the brahmins bathe their heads and dress in a new pair of linen robes. They make a heap of fresh cow dung and spread it with green grass. Then they make their beds between the boundary and the fire chamber.

segments.pli: Te taṃ rattiṃ tikkhattuṃ paccuṭṭhāya pañjalikā aggiṃ namassanti:
segments.en: That night they rise three times and worship the fire with joined palms:
‘We descend, lord! We descend, lord!’
And they serve the fire with abundant ghee, oil, and butter.

segments.pli: Tassā ca rattiyā accayena paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena brāhmaṇe santappenti.
segments.en: And when the night has passed they serve the brahmins with a variety of delicious foods.

segments.pli: Evaṃ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent.”

segments.pli: “Aññathā kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hoti, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
segments.en: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the noble one.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti?
segments.en: “But Master Gotama, how is the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the noble one?

segments.pli: Sādhu me bhavaṃ gotamo tathā dhammaṃ desetu yathā ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
segments.en: Master Gotama, please teach me this.”

segments.pli: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes sir,” Jāṇussoṇi replied.
The Buddha said this:
“It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
‘Wrong view has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,
they descend from wrong view.
‘Wrong thought has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong thought,
they descend from wrong thought.
‘Wrong speech has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong speech,
they descend from wrong speech.
‘Wrong action has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong action,
they descend from wrong action.
‘Wrong livelihood has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong livelihood,
they descend from wrong livelihood.
‘Wrong effort has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong effort,
they descend from wrong effort.
‘Wrong mindfulness has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong mindfulness,
they descend from wrong mindfulness.
‘Wrong immersion has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong immersion,
they descend from wrong immersion.
‘Wrong knowledge has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong knowledge,
they descend from wrong knowledge.
‘Wrong freedom has a bad result
in both this life and the next.’
Reflecting like this, they give up wrong freedom,
they descend from wrong freedom.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
segments.en: This is the ceremony of descent in the training of the noble one.”

segments.pli: “Aññathā, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti.
segments.en: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the noble one.

segments.pli: Imissā ca, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇiyā brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
segments.en: And, Master Gotama, the ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of a master of the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the noble one.
Excellent, Master Gotama! …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
